Plant nutrition is the study of the chemical elements and compounds necessary for plant growth and reproduction Plant nutrition is the study of the chemical elements and compounds necessary for plant growth and reproduction, plant metabolism and their external supply. In its absence the plant is unable to complete a normal life cycle, or that the element is part of some essential plant constituent or metabolite. This is in accordance with Justus von law of the minimum.

1. Carbon – Carbon forms the backbone of most plant biomolecules, including proteins, starches and cellulose. Carbon is fixed through photosynthesis, this converts carbon dioxide from the air into carbohydrates which are used to store and transport energy within the plan 2. Hydrogen– Hydrogen is necessary for building sugars and building the plant. It is obtained almost entirely from water. Hydrogen ions are imperative for a proton gradient to help drive the electron transport chain in photosynthesis and for respiration 3. Oxygen– Oxygen is a component of many organic and inorganic molecules within the plant, and is acquired in many forms. These include: O2 and CO2 (mainly from the air via leaves)

Plants take up essential elements from the soil through their roots and from the air through their leaves. Nutrient uptake in the soil is achieved by cation exchange, wherein root hairs pump hydrogen ions into the soil through proton pumps

Mint is a fast-growing, aromatic herb known for its cool, refreshing flavor and distinctive scent.Belonging to the family, mint includes a variety of species.

Mentha, also known as mint, is a genus of flowering plants in the mint family, . It is estimated that 13 to 24 species exist, but the exact distinction between species is unclear. The plant typically grows in moist, partially shaded areas and spreads quickly through underground runners. Its leaves are soft, serrated, and often have a slightly fuzzy texture.
Coriander is a versatile herb prized for both its fresh leaves and dried seeds, each offering distinct flavors and culinary uses.Belonging to the family.

Coriander, a feathery annual plant of the parsley family, is also known by the name cilantro. The name coriander is usually used to refer to the dry fruits and seeds. The plant\'s delicate young leaves are known as cilantro. It is known by different names around the world—“cilantro” refers to the fresh leaves (especially in American English), while “coriander” often refers to the dried seeds or the entire plant.The plant features delicate, feathery green leaves and small white or pale pink flowers.

Ginger is a pungent, aromatic root (technically a rhizome) widely used as both a spice and a natural remedy.It comes from the plant Zingiber It is an herbaceous perennial that grows annual pseudostems

Ginger is a flowering plant whose rhizome, ginger root or ginger, is widely used as a spice and a folk medicine. This versatile root is a staple in many global cuisines, including Indian, Chinese, Thai, and Middle Eastern. It is used fresh, dried, powdered, or as a juice or oil.

Mentha, also known as mint, is a genus of flowering plants in the mint family, It is estimated that 13 to 24 species exist, but the exact distinction between species is unclear. Hybridization occurs naturally where some species ranges overlap. Many hybrids and cultivars are known.

1.Agastache - known as horse mints
 2.Calamintha - known as calamints
 3.Clinopodium acinos - known as mint
 4.Melissa - known as balm mint
 5.Origanum - known as rock mint
Same seeds but different looking plants
